column3:
以前はうらやましいと思ったけど
最近は――ああ、僕も歳を取ったのかな
column4:
I used to think it was enviable. But lately—ah, I
guess I've also gotten older.

column3:
レスタニアハーブの爽やかな香り
大好きなのよね
column4:
The refreshing scent of Lestania Herb,
I simply love it.

column3:
普段使いにはここで十分よ
たまにはもっといいお湯に行きたいけどね
column4: For everyday use, here is more than enough. But occasionally, I would like to go to a place with even better hot water.

column3: あら、こんにちは
column4: Oh, hello.

column3:
ああ、たまらんたまらん
こうぐぐっと！
湯上りのいっぱいは格別だよ
column4:
Oh, it's irresistible, irresistible.
Let's indulge!
The feeling after a bath is truly exceptional.

column3: 山歩き後のひとっ風呂は最高だよ、うむ
column4: A hot bath after hiking in the mountains is the best, mmm.

column3:
これがあるからキノザは離れられん
毎日何時間でも飽きんよ
column4:
This is why I can't leave Kinoza.
I could spend hours there every day and never get tired of it.

column3: はー、良い湯だったぞぉ
column4: Ah, it was a good hot bath.

column3:
ここのお風呂、お気に入りなの
お肌にも良くて、ほら、髪も柔らかくなるの
column4: The bath here is my favorite. It's good for the skin, and look, it makes the hair soft too.

column3:
滝の音を聞きながらこうしてると
嫌な事も忘れられるわ
column4: Listening to the sound of the waterfall, I can forget about unpleasant things.

column3: 森の泉みたいで綺麗よね、ここ
column4: It's beautiful like a forest's spring, isn't it?

column3: うふふ、ご機嫌いかが？
column4: How are you doing today?

column3:
キノザ鉱泉はもともと、騎士団が戦いの傷を
癒す湯治場だったと聞く
column4: I heard that Kinoza Mineral Springs was originally a healing hot spring for knights to heal their battle wounds.

column3:
それを一般に開放し、今のような浴場に仕立てた
のがロイの祖父さんだって話だ
column4: It is said that Roy's grandfather was the one who opened it to the public and turned it into a bathhouse like the one we have now.

column3:
でもま、改装して３つの温泉に分けたのは
ロイのヤツだけどな
あいつは商才があるよ
column4: But well, it was Roy who divided it into three separate hot springs during the renovations. He's got a knack for business.

column3:
キノザ名物、お互いしっかり楽しんで
いこうじゃないか
ああ、しかし良い湯だ！
column4:
Let's both enjoy Kinoza's specialty.
What wonderful hot springs!

column3:
この湯の効果は精力増進！
むふふ、まあその元気をどう使うかは
人それぞれだけどな
column4: The effects of this hot spring will enhance energy! Well, how you use that energy is up to each individual.

column3: よお、話でもどうだ？
column4: Hey, how are you doing? Want to have a chat?

column3:
殿方も、お嬢様も
ごゆっくりおくつろぎくださいませ
column4: Both Lord and Lady, please make yourselves comfortable and relax.

column3:
こちらは森の活力をイメージした
浴場、《活力の泉》でございますの
森と滝を模した、自然と憩いの空間ですわ
column4:
This is the Bathhouse, "Spring of Vitality," which embodies the energy of the forest. 
It is a space that recreates the forest and waterfall, offering a natural and relaxing environment.

column3:
温泉のお湯は、直接浴びるだけでなく
調合材料としても重宝されておりますのよ
column4: Not only is hot spring water useful for bathing, but it is also highly regarded as an ingredient for mixing.

column3:
《活力の泉》のお湯をお分け
いたしますわ
column4: I will share the hot water from the "Spring of Vitality" with you.

column3:
この温泉は《豊穣の泉》と
呼ばれております
column4: This hot spring is called the "Spring of Abundance".

column3:
その昔、白竜様がボルドの頂きに舞い降り
この地を祝福されたとか
本泉はその時に湧きでたという伝承があるのです
column4:
Long ago, it is said that the White Dragon descended upon the peak of Volden and blessed this land. 
There is a legend that during that time, the spring of the fountain began to flow.

column3: 貴方様に白竜様とレスタニアの祝福を
column4: May the blessings of The White Dragon and Lestania be upon you.

column3:
ハーブと薬花で練った薫りの香を
使用しています
舞う花弁と共に、極上のくつろぎをお楽しみください
column4: We use the scent of herbs and medicinal flowers. Please enjoy the soothing aroma along with the floating petals for an exquisite sense of relaxation.

column3:
こちらでは、《豊穣の泉》にぴったりの
お飲み物を用意しています
どうぞお試しくださいませ
column4: Here, we have prepared a perfect drink for the "Spring of Abundance". Please feel free to try it.

column3:
ここは落ちつきますね
心身ともに清められるかのようです
column4: This place is calming, isn't it? It feels like both mind and body are being purified.

column3:
静かに泉に身をゆだね
花々の薫りを楽しむ――
column4: Quietly relax in the spring and enjoy the fragrance of the flowers--

column3:
このようなぜいたくが許されるわたくし達は
幸せ者ですね
column4: We, who are allowed such luxury, are fortunate individuals, aren't we?

column3:
傷だけでなく、心の安息を求めて
ここを訪れる方も多いと聞きます
column4: I hear that many people come to visit this place not only for physical injuries, but also for seeking peace of mind.

column3:
前に見かけた女性の覚者の方
少し心配だったのです
column4: I was a little worried about the female Arisen I saw before.

column3: どこか思いつめた様子だったから――
column4: Because she seemed somewhat troubled...

column3: こんにちは
column4: Hello

column3:
うーん、本当に良いお湯！！
あたくしのような女に相応しい高級感ざます
column4: Mmmm, really nice hot water! It has a luxurious feel that a woman like me deserves!

column3:
ここはあたくし達セレブな人間にとっての
社交場でもあるんざます
column4: This is a social gathering place for us celebrities.

column3:
貴重な情報は価値ある者にのみ、ざます
お～ほほほほ
column4:
Valuable information is only for the worthy.
Oh-ho-ho!

column3:
どぉ？　この玉のようなお肌！
毎日通ってぴちぴちざます！
column4: How about this flawless skin? It stays tight and fresh every day!

column3: んまっ、ご機嫌あそばせ
column4: Welcome, please enjoy yourself.

column3:
豊穣の泉は、健康だけでなく
白竜様のご加護に満ちているという
ふふ、私の商売も成功間違いない
column4:
The Spring of Abundance is said to be filled not only with good health but also with the divine protection of the White Dragon. 
Hehe, there's no doubt my business will be a success.

column3:
ここで知り合った縁だ
裸の付き合いというのではないが
いい商売話があれば紹介しようではないか
column4:
This is the connection we made here.
It's not a casual relationship.
If there is a good business opportunity, let me introduce it.

column3:
ここあってこそ、キノザを拠点にしている
意味があるというものだ
column4: It is thanks to this place, Kinoza, that it has meaning.

column3: あぁ、私に何か？
column4: Ah, what do you need from me?

column3: 白竜様のご加護があらんことを
column4:
May the blessings of The White Dragon
be with you, Arisen.

column3: リムの輝きは常に貴方と共に
column4: Even now, the Rift's glow shields you.

column3: 旅の同伴者をお求めですか？　覚者様
column4: Are you looking for a travel companion, Lord Arisen?

column3:
メンバーの再編をお考えでしたら
なんなりと
column4:
If you are thinking of reorganizing your 
party members, please do not hesitate 
to ask.

column3:
当キノザ鉱泉では、効能の異なる３種の
お湯を楽しむことができますの
column4: At Kinoza Mineral Springs, you can enjoy three types of hot springs with different effects.

column3:
ハーブ薫る《癒しの泉》は体力回復に――
森の精力が宿る《活力の泉》はスタミナ上昇効果が、
そして白竜様の加護を受けた《豊穣の泉》は
最大体力上昇の効果がありますの
column4:
The spring of healing, fragrant with herbs, is for health recovery—
The spring of vitality, filled with the energy of the forest, grants a stamina boost—
And the spring of abundance, blessed by the White Dragon's divine protection, has the effect of increasing maximum health points.

column3:
特に《活力の泉》と《豊穣の泉》は
入浴後、しばらく効果が続きますので
冒険前のご利用もおすすめですわ
column4: In particular, the Springs of Vitality and Abundance, after bathing, the effects will continue for a while, so it is recommended to use them before embarking on an Adventure as well.

column3:
浴場への入場キーはこちらで販売しております！
ご一緒に軽食やお飲み物もいかがですか？
column4: We sell entrance keys to the bathhouse here! How about enjoying some light snacks and drinks together?

column3:
３種ある浴場は、いずれもお客様の自由な
スタイルで入場いただけますわ
column4: There are three types of baths, and all of them can be entered in a style that the customer is free to choose.

column3:
服を脱いで全身でお湯を楽しんでいただくもよし
鎧ごと浸かって汚れと汗を流すもよしです
column4:
You can enjoy the hot water by taking off your clothes and immersing your entire body. 
You can also soak in the bath with your armor to wash away dirt and sweat.

column3:
あ、でも他のお客様への迷惑行為は
ご遠慮くださいね
column4: Oh, but please refrain from causing inconvenience to other customers, okay?

column3: 憩いの泉、キノザ鉱泉へようこそ！
column4: Welcome to Kinoza Mineral Springs, a place of relaxation.

column3: 泉のご案内をいたしますね
column4: I will guide you to the fountain right away.

column3:
右の浴場が《癒しの泉》
左の浴場が《活力の泉》
そして中央が《豊穣の泉》となっておりますわ
column4:
On the right is the Spring of Healing,
On the left is the Spring of Vitality,
And in the center is the Spring of Abundance.

column3:
ふふふ、僕もちょくちょく鉱泉を利用するのさ
もちろん最高にゴージャスな《豊穣の泉》だよ！
column4: Hehehe, I also make use of the hot springs from time to time, you know. It's, of course, the highest and most luxurious Spring of Abundance!

column3:
ハーブの芳しい爽やかな薫り、エメラルド色の湯！
容姿端麗なる紳士淑女との語らい！
column4:
The fragrant aroma of herbs, the refreshing emerald-colored bath!
A conversation with graceful gentlemen and ladies!

column3:
まさに泉のごとく、僕の創作意欲も
湧こうというものさ
君もぜひ行ってみるべきだね！
column4:
Indeed, like a spring, my creative drive is welling up, you know.
You should definitely give it a try too!

column3:
さぁさ、飲んで歌って騒いで！
キノザで楽しい思い出を作っていってよ
column4:
Come on, let's drink, sing, and make some noise!
Let's create fun memories at Kinoza!

column3:
僕の演奏がそれに一役買えれば本望さ
――あ、チップは宿代に含んでるからね
column4:
If my performance can contribute in any way, I would be more than satisfied. 
Oh, and the tip is included in the accommodation fee, so don't worry about it.

column3:
この泉と宝石のキノザで、僕はそれより
輝き癒される運命のヒトを探してるのさ
column4:
In this spring and Kinoza of gems,
I am searching for the person whose destiny is to be healed,
and to be illuminated by its radiance.

column3:
美しくて懐が暖かな――じゃない、
心が豊かなそんなヒトをね！
column4:
Not just beautiful and warm-hearted,
But someone with a rich heart!

column3: はぁ～い、僕に用かい？
column4: Hello, can I help you?

column3:
おお、泊っていくのか、だったら
<VAL PRICE_INN>だ
――だが、こんな場所だから大したもてなしは
期待しないでくれよ、それでもいいか？
column4:
Oh, you're planning to stay here? In that case, it will be <VAL PRICE_INN>.
However, don't expect much hospitality in a place like this. Is that still okay?

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
ああ、《弱化の治療》なら
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>だよ
――言い訳ではないが
足元を見ているわけじゃないんだよ
column4:
Ah, if it's "Treat Weakness," it costs <VAL PRICE_WEAK>, you know.
It's not an excuse, but I'm not looking down on you.

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
君は《弱化》にはなっていないようだ
――うむ、よかったじゃないか
弱ってるのは気のせいだよ
column4:
It seems that you haven't weakened after all.
Well, that's good, isn't it?
You're just imagining that you're weak.

column3: ――おぉ、これは旅の方、用件を伺うよ
column4: -Oh, travelers, I have come to inquire about your purpose here.

column3:
はあぁぁ――、日々ぎりぎりの生活だ
１日５回は溜息がでる
今までなんとか持ちこたえているが
column4:
Ohhh... I live on the edge every day.
I let out a sigh at least five times a day.
I've managed to hang on until now, but...

column3:
だが、わたしは移住はしたくないんだよ
だってこんな村でも、たった一つの
故郷だものなぁ――
column4:
But, I don't want to move.
Because even in a village like this, it's my one and only home.

column3:
オークにやられきり、村を全部廃墟になんか
させたくないものなぁ――
column4: I don't want the village to become a complete ruin, destroyed by Orcs.

column3:
ゆっくりしていくといい
といっても、我々ができることは知れているがね
ふうぅ――
column4:
It would be good to take it easy.
That being said, there are things we know we can do.
Phew--

column3: はぁぁ――サニーにも苦労をかけてばかりだなぁ
column4: Sunny, I always seem to be causing you trouble, huh?

column3:
どうか、手が空いてればいいんだが
あれの仕事も手伝ってやってくれないだろうか
column4: I hope you're not too busy, but could you possibly help me with that task?

column3:
家畜や集落を守るのも、今はゴート頼みだ
我々を助けると思って、一匹でもオークを
減らしていってくれるとありがたい
column4:
To protect livestock and settlements, we now rely on Gort. 
It would be appreciated if you could help us could help us by reducing the Orcs numbers even by one.

column3:
本当、どうか一つ頼むよ
これ以上豚がやられたら
我々がワラを喰うはめに――
はぁああああ――
column4:
Please, I beg of you.
If any more pigs are harmed, we will be forced to eat straw---
Haaaahhh---

column3:
ああ、泊っていくのか、そうか！
料金なんてもちろん不要さ！
――はぁああ、本当ならもっともてなしをしたい所
なのに、何もない村ですまないなぁ
column4:
Ah, are you going to stay overnight? I see!
Of course, the fee is not necessary!
Ah, if only I could entertain you more, but in this village, there is nothing, I'm sorry.

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
あらぁ～、ホントよく来てくれたねぇ！！
あんたみたいな人が来てくれると
エンポリオの意固地にも意味があるってもんだ
column4:
Ohh, you've come here again! 
When someone like you comes, it gives meaning to Emporio's stubbornness.

column3:
ああ、エンポリオには会った？
あれ、わたしの夫なんだよね
column4:
Oh, have you met Emporio?
That's my husband.

column3:
このあたりはオークに支配されてから
すっかり荒れ地になっちまってね――
column4: This area has become a wasteland since it came under the domination of the Orcs.

column3:
だからハイデルあたりへ移住しようって
いつも言ってるんだけど夫はどうしても
この故郷を守るって意地を張るんだ
column4:
That's why I always say let's move to Heidell or somewhere.
But my husband insists on protecting this hometown out of sheer obstinacy.

column3:
あの人、溜息ばっかりでしょ？
それを見てるとなんだかさぁ
仕方ない、支えてやらなくちゃって、ここ――
バートランド北部のエリアマスターをしてるわけ
column4:
That person, always sighing, right?
When I see that, somehow,
I can't help but support them, because here--
They are the Area Master of Betland.

column3:
張り切って手伝うから、神殿に戻ったら
ドラワンを見捨てるなって伝えてよね
ほら、神官様とか、えらい人にさ
column4:
When we return to the temple, please let them know not to abandon Drawan. 
You know, the priests and important people. I'll help enthusiastically, so don't worry. 
From now on, we will take care of Drawan together.

column3:
もうさ、あんたがさ、ドラワンのために――
ここまで尽くしてくれて――
顔見たら涙が滲んじまったよ
column4:
You know, you've done so much for Drawan--
I couldn't help but tear up when I saw your face...

column3:
ううっ、わたしには大それたことできないけどさ
これでちょっとでもあんたの役に立てるなら――
column4: Ugh, I can't do much, but if this helps you in any way--

column3: ぐずっ！　あらやだ鼻が――
column4: *Sniff*! Oh no, my nose—

column3:
あんたが手伝ってくれて
いつもほんっと助かってるよ！
感謝してるんだから
column4: You always help me out, and I really appreciate it! I'm grateful to you.

column3:
そうだ、これをお礼にと思ってね
使い勝手良さそうでしょ？
これからもお願いね！
column4:
Oh yeah, and I thought I'd return the favor with this one:
Looks easy to use, doesn't it?
Keep up the good work, please!

column3:
何かと手伝ってくれてありがとうね！
大したことはできないけど、こいつぁ礼だよ
column4: Thank you so much for helping me out! I may not be able to do much, but this is my way of saying thanks.

column3:
最近あんたが来てくれるのが楽しみでね！
はりきってこんなもん用意しちゃったよ！
さ、持っていっておくれ
column4:
I've been looking forward to your visits lately!
I'm so excited to have you here that I prepared this for you!
Go ahead, take it.

column3:
しょーもない村だけどさ
みんなあんたにゃ感謝してるんだ
いつでも来ておくれよ！
column4:
It may be a trivial village, but everyone is thankful to you.
Please come visit anytime!

column3:
いつも顔だしてくれて悪いね！
せっかく来てくれて旦那の溜息ばっかりってのも
あれだし、これをあげるよ
column4:
I'm sorry for always bothering you! 
It's not good for you to come all the way here and only hear my husband's sighs. 
So, here's something for you.

column3: 遠慮せず使っておくれ
column4: Please feel free to use it.

column3:
わざわざこんなヘンピなとこまで
来てもらって悪いね！
そうだ、これあげるよ、使っておくれ
column4:
I'm sorry for making you come all the way to this strange place! 
Oh, I know, I'll give you this. Please use it.

column3:
あらぁ、ドラワンによく来たね！
仕事の相談かい？
column4:
Oh, you come here to Drawan often, don't you?
Are you here to discuss work?

column3: よーし、今日も張り切っていくよ！
column4: Alright, let's go! I'm all pumped up for today!

column3:
あの人、いつも溜息ばっかりでしょ
最初はつられてわたしも溜息出てたんだけど
なんだか最近逆にやる気がでてきてね
column4:
That person is always sighing, aren't they? 
At first, I was caught up in it and found myself sighing too, but lately, I've strangely been getting more motivated.

column3:
女房だし、支えてやらなきゃって
思うのかしらね
column4: I wonder if she thinks I have to support her since she's my wife.

column3:
手伝ってくれるならどんなことでも嬉しいよ！
できる範囲でいいからね
column4: I would be glad to help with anything within my abilities!

column3:
何かと手伝ってくれてありがとうね！
ちょっとでもいいもんを、あんたに
譲ったげるからさ
column4:
Thank you for all the help!
I'll give you something, even if it's just a little.

column3: 大したことはできないけど、こいつぁ礼だよ
column4: I can't do much, but here's a token of appreciation.

column3:
あ、あんた！
いいとこに来たね、お知らせだよ
column4:
Ah, there you are!
You've come at a good time, I have some news for you.

column3:
《バートランド地下道》って道が、
川を渡って東に行った高台の上にあるのさ
column4: The Betland Underground Passage is a road that is located on a hill east of a river.

column3:
あのあたり、ずっとオーク共が変なイヌを
飼うのに使ってて、おまけに地下道も中から
封鎖されてたのよね
column4: In that area, Orcs have been keeping strange canines as pets, and on top of that, the underground passage has been blocked from the inside.

column3:
だけど、南の平原側から隊士さんが来て
開通できたみたいなのよね
今はオーク達もどっか行ってるみたいだし
せっかくだから通ってみたら？
column4:
But it seems like soldiers are coming from the southern plain.
They say it's now open for passage.
The Orcs seem to have gone somewhere else too.
Since we've come this far, why not give it a try?

column3:
ちょっと嫌な話があるのさ
ガルドノック砦――オーク達の砦前で
出陣準備をしてる連中がいるみたいなのよ
column4:
There's something unpleasant I need to tell you. 
It seems that there are some folks preparing for departure outside the Gardnox Fortress, the Orc stronghold.

column3:
《砦前・千本棘の陣》さ
もしそういうオーク達を見たら、邪魔して
やってくれないかい？
column4: Fortress Front: Barbed Line, huh? If you happen to come across those Orcs, could you please intervene and get rid of them for me?

column3:
オークの部隊なんてのが
ドラワンに来られちゃ、たまったもんじゃないよ！
column4: An orc squad coming to Drawan is no laughing matter!

column3:
グリッテンだっけ、そっちの方に
行く連中かもしれないしさ
column4: Gritten, right? Maybe they're going to that way.

column3: あんた！　ちょっと聞いてよ！
column4: Hey, listen up!

column3:
ドラワン教会の《地下納骨堂》
なんだけどさ――
column4: The Drawan Church's "Underground Crypt" - you know, I was thinking...

column3:
すっごく気になる事が分かってさ
どうにか頼りになる人に中の様子を
見て来てほしいのよ
column4: I just found out something that's really bugging me and I need someone I can count on to go take a look at what's going on inside.

column3:
ねぇ、後生だから！！
お願いできないかい？
今は入れるようになってるからさ
column4:
Hey, I'm younger, you know!
Can't you do me a favor?
Because now I can join in.

column3:
あんたが手伝ってくれて、いつも
ほんっと助かってるよ！
感謝してるんだから
column4: You always help me out, and I really appreciate it! I'm grateful to you.

column3:
そうだ、これをお礼にと思ってね
使い勝手良さそうなもの、回したげるよ！
column4:
Oh yeah, and I thought I'd return the favor with this one:
Looks easy to use, doesn't it?
Keep up the good work, please!

column3: これからもお願いね！
column4: Keep up the good work!

column3:
ちょっとちょっと、ニュースだよ！
《フロックヴァルト大橋》の門が開いたのさ！
column4: Hey, hey, I've got news for you! The gates of the Flocwald Bridge have opened!

column3:
なんで急に開いたかはわからないんだけど
どうしてかね、禁域で何かあったのかね？
column4: I don't know why it suddenly opened, but I wonder if something happened in the Forbidden Zone.

column3:
あたしらはどっちにしろあまり関わりたく
ない場所だけど、あんたにとっては
禁域にいく理由があるかもしれないだろ
column4: We don't really want to get involved either way, but there might be a reason for you to go to the Forbidden Zone.

column3: もしそうなら、行ってみるといいよ
column4: If so, it's a good idea to go and check it out.

column3:
ちょっとちょっと、大変だよ！
東の地下道前なんだけど、またいつの間にか
オーク共がイヌの訓練を始めたみたいなんだ
column4:
Hey, hey, it's a big deal!
In front of the East Underground Passage, somehow, once again it looks like the Orcs have started training their dogs!

column3: せっかく居なくなったと思ってたのにさ！
column4: I thought they were gone for good!

column3:
やつら、この村や南の平原に攻め込むのに
イヌ共を使う気に違いないさね
column4: Those guys, they must be planning to use dogs to invade this village and the southern plains.

column3:
なんとか手を打てればいいんだけど――
あんた《魔犬養育所》、何とかできないかい？
column4:
I wish I could do something about it--
Can't you do something about it, the 《Demon Dog Kennel》?

column3:
あんたに一つお知らせがあるよ！
フロックヴァルト大橋近くの
《テゴル治水路》なんだけどさ
column4: I have a piece of news for you! It's about the "Tegor Flood Control Channel" near Flocwald Bridge.

column3:
あそこは、ガルドノック砦がオークに占領
された当時に、騎士団が封鎖した場所だったのよ
column4: At that time, Gardnox Fortress was occupied by Orcs, and it was the place that the Knight Order blocked.

column3:
それを引き継いで封鎖してきた
わけなんだけど、
古くても使える遺物があれば
活用したほうがいいじゃない？
column4: To take over and block it, wouldn't it be better to make use of any ancient relics that are still functional?

column3:
私らには危ないけど
あんたには役立つものもあるかも
しれないから、開けておいたよ
column4: It's not safe for us, but some of it might be useful for you so I opened it.

column3: 暇なら一度、覗いてみなよ！
column4: If you have free time, please take a look!

column3:
あぁ、どうしようかねぇ！
困ったことになったんだよ
column4:
Oh, I don't know what to do!
I'm in trouble.

column3:
ガルドノックから村に続く道の途中のさ
《ガルドノック哨戒地》なんだけど――
column4: From Gardnox Patrol Area, along the road leading to the village...

column3:
そこにすっごい大っきな牙のドラゴンが
出たってのよ！
column4: There, a dragon with huge fangs appeared!

column3:
どうしよう、ついにドラワンも終わりなのかねぇ
ああいやだいやだ――
column4:
I don't know, I wonder if this is finally the end of Drawan.
Oh no, no, no--

column3:
誰か――、そうだ、あんただ！
あんた、なんとかしておくれよ！
後生さね！
column4:
Somebody--yes, you!
You've got to do something!
For God's sake!

column3:
もうさ、あんたがさ、ドラワンのために――
ここまで尽くしてくれて――
顔見たら涙が滲んじまったよ
column4:
You know, you've done so much for Drawan--
I couldn't help but tear up when I saw your face...

column3:
ううぅっ、私には大それたことできないけどさ
ちょっとでもあんたの役に立てるなら――
column4: Ugh, I can't do much, but if I can be of any help to you at all--

column3: ぐずっ！　あらやだ鼻が――
column4: *Sniff*! Oh no, my nose—

column3:
ねぇねぇ、この辺りにある《辺境の礎》が
ぜ～んぶ使えるようになったんだって！
あんたの移動も楽になるよ、きっと！
column4: Hey hey, I heard that all the "Sub Portcrystals" around this area are now available for use! Your movement will definitely become easier, I'm sure!

column3:
こっちにまで礎を作ってくれるってことは
神殿もバートランド北部のこと
見捨てたわけじゃなかったんだね――
column4: The fact that they're even building a Keystone over heremeans that the Temple didn't abandon the northern part of Betland--.

column3:
ぐすっ
ああいやだよ、涙腺がゆるんじまって――
column4:
*Sob*
Oh no, I'm tearing up....

column3:
そうだ、これはあんたに相談しといた方が
良さそうな話なんだけどさ
column4: Yeah, I should probably talk to you about this

column3:
最近、ガルドノック砦の方が
何だか騒がしいんだよ
オークたちがやけに出たり入ったりしてるしね
column4: Lately, Gardnox Fortress has been quite noisy. The Orcs seem to be going in and out quite a bit.

column3:
もしも中でよからぬことが起こってたら
このドラワンだけじゃなく
グリッテンも危ないかも知れないよ
column4: If something inappropriate were happening inside, not only Drawan, but Gritten might also be in danger, you know.

column3:
あんたさえ良ければ
一度中を見て来てもらえると安心なんだけど――
column4: If you don't mind, I'd feel a lot safer if you came by once to take a look inside--

column3:
あ、中を見てきてくれるっていうなら
あたしに一声かけてから行ってね！
分かってること全部教えてあげるから！
column4:
Ah, if you're going to look inside, let me know first!
I'll tell you everything I know!

column3:
ちょうどよかったよ！
あんたに伝えておきたいことがあるんだ！
column4:
That's great!
I have something to tell you!

column3:
この前見てきてもらったガルドノック砦に
侵食されたオークがいただろ？
それを調査したいって騎士団の人たちが来てさ
column4: You know the Orcs that had invaded Gardnox Fortress that I showed you the other day? Some members of the knight order came to investigate it.

column3:
その騎士さんたちがガルドノック砦の奥にある
《ガルドノック廃水廊》ってところを調べたら
もう侵食が進んで大変なことになってたらしいよ
column4: It seems that those knights have investigated the Gardnox Wastewater Tunnel deep within Gardnox Fortress, and it appears that the corruption has advanced and become quite severe.

column3:
入口は多分騎士さんが開けたままになってるから
あんたも気になるなら見てくればいいよ
column4:
The entrance is probably still open because the Knight didn't close it.
If you're curious, you can take a look.

column3:
なんか調べてるんだろ？
あの侵食魔ってやつのこと
column4:
I wonder if you're looking up something?
About that thing called the Corruption Magic.

column3:
ああ、あんたかい
ちょっと聞いておくれよ
column4:
Ah, is it you?
Hey, could you listen for a moment?

column3:
何日か前さ、村の近くで
気持ちの悪い魔物を見たんだよ――
少なくともあたしはあんなの見たの初めてだよ
column4: A few days ago, I saw a creepy enemy near the village, you know. It's the first time I've ever seen something like that.

column3:
怒った男の顔がついたような魔物でね
目も赤く光ってたんだ！
column4: It was a monster with a face that looked like an angry man. Its eyes were also shining red!

column3:
――そこでお願いなんだけど、
《ガルドノック廃水廊》に
そいつが棲みついてないか
確認してきてほしいんだよ
column4:
-- So, I have a favor to ask.
Could you please go and check if it is residing in the "Gardnox Wastewater Tunnel"?
I would really appreciate it.

column3:
行ってくれるなら、くわしく説明するよ
あたしに声かけてね
column4:
If you go, I'll explain in detail.
Please contact me.

column3:
ううっ、いつもありがとね、ホント――
迷惑ばっかりかけてるっていうのに
こんな小さな村に変わらず立ち寄ってくれて――
column4:
Oh, thank you so much, really――
Despite causing nothing but trouble, you still stop by this small village unchanged――

column3:
問題を解決してくれるってことも嬉しいんだけどさ
あんたがさ、ここまでドラワンのことを
気にかけてくれるってこと自体が嬉しくて――
column4: I'm also happy that you solve problems for me, but what makes me truly glad is that you cared so much about Drawan until now.

column3:
あたしたちもあんたの役に立ちたいんだ
何にもない村だけど、精一杯あんたを支援させてよ
column4:
We also want to be of help to you. 
Though it's just a small village with nothing much, we will do our best to support you.

column3:
ぐずっ！
えへへ、目が赤くなっちゃったよ
みっともなくてごめんね
column4:
Oops!
Oh dear, my eyes have turned red.
I'm sorry for being so embarrassing.

column3: ――取引か？
column4: ――A Mere Transaction?

column3: 今ある品が全部だ
column4: This is all the items we currently have.

column3: 気に入るものはないか？
column4: See something you like?

column3: ――何か、買って行け
column4: ――Buy something and take it with you.

column3: おお、俺に用か？
column4: Oh, you wanted to see me?

column3:
こんな辺境によく来たな
魔物に食われないよう注意しろよ
column4:
I'm surprised you came to this remote area.
Be careful the demons don't eat you.

column3:
オーク共が根城を近くに構えてから
村人の半分は、ずっと昔に別の地方へ移った
column4: Since the orcs set up their stronghold nearby, half of the villagers have moved to another region a long time ago.

column3:
今残ってるのは諦め悪い連中の家系だが
そうこうしてるうち、砦と関所で隔てられて
ここに残らざるを得なくなったってとこだ
column4:
The only ones left are the stubborn descendants who refuse to give up. 
As time went on, we became separated by forts and checkpoints. 
And this is where we ended up, unable to leave.

column3: 俺もまぁ、そのクチだな
column4: I guess I'm that kind of person too.

column3:
オークに攫われた人間がどうなるか
考えたくもない――
column4: I don't even want to think about what happens to people kidnapped by orcs--

column3:
それを諦めきれないのが、俺がここにいる
理由だな――
column4: I can't give that up, which is why I'm here--

column3:
――このドラワンに残ってる者は
何かに囚われて動くことができない
者なのだろう
column4: Those who remain in Drawan are probably unable to move, as if they are trapped by something.

column3:
俺と同じような理由で囚われていた奴――
オークに攫われた恋人を追って奴らのアジト
《ガルドノック砦》へ潜入を試みた奴がいてな
column4:
There was someone who, for the same reason as me, was being held captive—
They attempted to infiltrate the hideout of the orcs, Gardnox Fortress, to rescue their kidnapped lover.

column3:
かなりのやり手だった
オークの部隊長を一人で倒し
砦の見取り図を手に入れたそうだ
俺から見てもすごい執念だったよ
column4:
He was quite a capable person. 
He single-handedly defeated the Orc captain and obtained a map of the fortress. 
It was an incredible determination even from my perspective.

column3:
あいつはどうなったのかな――
無事に恋人を助け出せたのなら
今頃は別の町にでも移っているのだろうが
column4:
I wonder what happened to that person--
If they were able to safely rescue their lover, They might have already moved to another town by now.

column3: まぁ、こんな村へようこそ
column4: Well, welcome to such a village!

column3:
家畜は私達の生命線なんです
ただでさえ土地が荒れてるっていうのに
これ以上、魔物に持っていかれたら――
column4:
Livestock is our lifeline.
The land is already barren, and if we lose any more to the enemy...

column3: 毎日、憂鬱なことばかりです
column4: Every day, it's nothing but depressing things.

column3:
北の地は昔から《禁じられた地》と呼ばれて
近づく人はいませんでした
column4: For centuries, the northern land has been known as the "Forbidden Land," with no one daring to come near.

column3:
オークもですが、ここは白竜様の加護のない
忌まわしい地なのです
column4: Orcs too, but this is an abominable place without the Divine Protection of The White Dragon!

column3:
そうだわ、聞いてください
オーク達は川向こうのどこかで
恐ろしい魔犬を飼い育てているそうなのです
column4:
Oh, please listen.
It seems that the Orcs are raising a terrifying demon dog somewhere across the river.

column3:
あの黒い霧のような息を吐く
大きな狼をです！
あぁ、何ということでしょう――
column4:
A large wolf that breathes out that black mist!
Oh, what a sight—

column3: そこの方、少し話を聞いてください
column4: Excuse me, could you please spare a moment to listen?

column3:
ドラワンから少し西へ行った岬の方に
教会があるのはご存知でしょうか？
column4: Do you know that there is a church in the direction of the cape a little to the west of Drawan?

column3:
あの教会、実は司祭が魔物に襲われて
廃墟になったという噂なのです
――恐ろしいことです
column4:
That church is actually rumored to have been abandoned after the priest was attacked by demons

--a horrible thing!

column3:
オーク達が棲みついている《ガルドノック砦》
それに近辺に残る遺構のほとんどは
大昔の騎士団のものなのだそうです
column4: The fortress where the orcs dwell, Gardnox Fortress, is said to be mostly comprised of remnants from an ancient knight order.

column3:
北の地には、巨大な橋がかかっているそうです
《フロックヴァルト大橋》という
大変な旧時代の遺構であるとか
column4:
In the northern lands, there is a huge bridge called the "Flocwald Bridge". 
It is said to be a magnificent relic from ancient times of the land.

column3:
しかし、あくまで噂にすぎません
危険を冒して確かめに行くほどの勇気も余力も
持ち合わせておりませんので
column4:
However, it is just a rumor. 
I do not have the courage or resources to go and confirm it at the risk of danger.

column3:
村の少し北、《ガルドノック哨戒地》の
あたりで、おどろくほど大きな足跡が
あったんです
column4: In the area a little north of the village, in the Gardnox Patrol Area, there were surprisingly large footprints on the earth.

column3:
あれは、オークのものなのか
もっと別の魔物のなのか――
column4: Is that an Orc's or some other enemy?

column3:
気にはなりますが、とてもとても
確かめるような勇気も気力もありません
column4: I'm curious, but I don't have the courage or energy to check.

column3:
素材を扱っていますよ
見ていかれますか？
column4:
We deal in materials.
Would you like to take a look?

column3:
植物や鉱石の採取もここでは命がけです
くれぐれも、あなたも警戒を
column4: Collecting plants and ores here is also a matter of life and death. Please be extremely cautious, and observe your surroundings.

column3:
バートランド北部にしか自生していない植物や
発見されていない鉱石もかなりの数があります
column4: There are a considerable number of plants and ores that are native only to the northern part of Betland and have not been discovered until now.

column3:
南へ行けば、もっと高値で取引き
されるのでしょうね
column4: If I go south, I suppose I can make transactions at even higher prices.

column3:
薬草一つが命綱となることもあります
特に、ここドラワンのような環境では
column4: There are times when a single medicinal herb becomes a lifeline. Especially in environments like Drawan.

column3: あぁ？　何か言いてぇことでも？
column4: Yeah?　You got something to say?

column3:
しみったれた村だよなぁ、ったく！
エンポリオやゴートのオッサンくらいしか
飲み相手もいねぇしよ！
column4: What a boring village, seriously! There's no one to drink with except for old geezers like Emporio and Gort!

column3:
キャプテンオーク共の角飾りよ
あれ、あいつらが作りやがったんかな？
売りゃそこそこ金になりそうだよな
column4:
Captain Orc's horns.
I wonder if they made those?
I'm sure they'd make some money selling them.

column3:
遠出するのも面倒臭ぇが、いっぺん
キノザや神殿にゃ行ってみてぇな
column4: It's a hassle to travel, but I'd love to go to Kinoza and the temple once.

column3:
おお、そういやぁよ
砦前のあそこ――なんつったっけ
《千本砦の陣》だっけ？
column4:
Oh, by the way, speaking of it
What was it called over there in front of the fortress?
Was it "The Thousand Bastion Fortress"?

column3:
あそこにオークの隊長格が
部隊をぞろぞろ連れてることがあんだよ
column4: There's an Orc captain over there with a whole troop of them.

column3:
きっとありゃあ、南の砦攻めの準備部隊だぜ
おかげでこの村は無視してくれるがな
column4: There must be a preparation force for the attack on the Southern Fortress. Thanks to that, they're ignoring this village.

column3: 旅の同伴者をお求めでしょうか、覚者殿
column4: Are you looking for a traveling companion, Master Arisen?

column3: 白竜様のご加護があらんことを
column4:
May the blessings of The White Dragon
be with you, Arisen.

column3: リムの輝きは常に貴方と共に
column4: Even now, the Rift's glow shields you.

column3:
メンバーの再編でしたら
私にお申し付けください
column4: If you are reorganizing your membership, please contact me at

column3:
いらっしゃい！
さー、じっくり見てっておくれよ！
column4: Welcome! Now, take your time and have a good look!

column3:
この辺りを探検するなら

If you're going to explore this area, you'll need to be well equipped and prepared!
Spare no expense, spare no life!

使ってるんだ

Zoma reuses everything!
From houses to shops to wells, they use the ruins as they are.

ここはザンドラ禁域が開かれて、
モノ好きが集まって急にできた拠点なんだ
ちょっと前から住んでた人もいるみたいだけどね
column4:
Here, the Zandora Wastelands have been opened, and it's become a gathering place for enthusiasts of all things.
There seem to be people who have been living here for a little while now.

column3:
お客さん！　うちに滞在している大剣豪
オリバーさんにはもう会ったかい？

あの人は《ウォリアー》として有名らしいから
挨拶していくといいよ！
弟子入りの順番待ちもいるそうだよ

That person seems to be famous as a "Warrior", so it's a good idea to greet them! 
It seems there's also a waiting list for apprenticeship.

column3:
こんにちは
道具類は足りてるかしら？
column4: Hi! Do you have enough tools?

column3:
自分の身は自分で守る
それがここの鉄則よ
何かあっても自分を恨むしかないからね
column4:
Protect your own body.
That is the golden rule here.
If something happens, you will only have yourself to blame, you know.

column3:
私は禁域が開かれる少し前から
ここにいるの
バートランドから禊の神殿の
《湖底連絡路》を通ってね
column4:
I've been here since just before the Forbidden Zone was opened. 
You can reach here from Betland through the 'Lakebottom Connecting Passage' to the Temple of Purification.

column3:
バートランドからオークに追われ
こっちへ移ってきた人は他にもいるわ
column4: I know others who moved here after being chased from Betland by orcs.

column3:
連絡路には恐ろしい魔物もいるし
ここしばらく封鎖されてたようだけど
column4:
There are terrifying enemies in the connecting channel. 
It appears to have been blocked for some time.

column3:
良ければイザベルの話も聞いてやってね
あの子にはよく店を手伝ってもらうの
column4:
If it's alright with you, please also listen to Isabel's story.
She often helps out at the shop.

column3: あら、こんにちは！
column4: Oh, hello!

column3:
あなたも探索者ですか？
上の墓地群や廃墟群はもう行かれました？
私も戦いの心得があったら見学したいです
column4:
Are you also a reward hunter?
Have you already been to the cemetery and ruins up there?
If I had the knowledge of battle, I would like to visit as well.

column3:
私、ここでゾマに集まる物資の保管を
お手伝いしてるんです
《クエストボード》で依頼することも
ありますので、よろしくお願いしますね
column4:
I'm assisting with the storage of supplies gathered by Zoma here. 
I also handle requests through the Quest Board, so if you would be so kind, please feel free to ask. 
Nice to meet you!

column3:
ケイシー姉さんの店にはぜひお立ち寄りを！

Please be sure to stop by Casey's shop! 
You'll be in trouble if you don't have any tools when you need them.

How about taking a nap and having a meal?

ようこそ！　ゾマ組合宿は

メルゴダが滅び、人が南へ集ってからというもの
長らく打ち捨てられておったのですが
オークから逃げた人が各地から流れ
遺跡に隠れ住むようになったのですな

最近は、にわかに遺跡目当ての冒険者や
盗賊まがいが集うようになり、賑やかに
なってまいりましたな！
column4: Recently, there has been a sudden influx of adventurers and bandits gathering around the ruins, making it lively around here!

column3:
ささ、酒場で景気よく飲み食いし
金を落としてゾマを活気づけて下され！！
column4: So, eat and drink at the bars, drop some money, and keep Zoma alive!

column3: 少しだけ語らせてもらいますぞ
column4: Let me tell you a little about it.

今は禁じられた術、錬金術とよばれる技が
メルゴダでは盛んに研究されてましてな
column4: A technique now forbidden, called alchemy, is being actively studied in Mergoda.

変な金属が埋め込まれた魔物達は

いわばメルゴダ民の使い魔なのだとか

The monsters embedded with strange metal were reportedly used as soldiers at that time. 
So to speak, they were the Mergoda people's familiars.

column3:
それも、元の生き物より格段に強く
改造されていたと言います
column4: And they say that it was significantly stronger than the original creature after being modified.

column3:
いやぁ、魔物を意のままに操りそれを
使役するなど、恐ろしくもあり素晴らしくもある！
驚きですな！
column4: Oh, controlling monsters at will and using them as your own... It's both terrifying and amazing! Truly astonishing!

column3:
おおお、結構結構！！
じっくり飲んで休んで英気を養って下され！
宿代はあなたの活躍で十分ですぞ
column4:
Oh, oh, quite good, quite good!!
Take your time to drink and rest, and regain your heroic spirit!
The lodging fee is more than enough with your outstanding performance.

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

そういうヤツは大体大事なとこでポカを

してるんだ

遺跡荒らしがスケルトンに、

あんた、そこそこ腕が立ちそうだね
もしかして、丘の上にある教会下の
墓地遺跡狙いかい？
column4:
You seem to have some skills, huh?
Are you aiming for the cemetery ruins beneath the church on top of the hill, by any chance?

column3:
あそこは馬鹿が何人も戻らなくなって
今は入れないんじゃなかったかね
column4:
Over there, there were several foolish people who have stopped coming back.
I suppose it's now off-limits, isn't it?

column3:
そうそう、ひとつ教えてあげる
東の谷――《奇岩谷》ってとこは
行かない方がいいよ
column4: Oh, I have something to tell you. It's better not to go to the Eastern Valley, called the Odd Rock Valley.

column3:
あそこ、気持ち悪いのがうようよ溜まってんの！
デロデロして、斬ったらびちゃびちゃ飛んでくるしで
ホント最悪！
column4:
There, it's filled with disgusting things! 
It's all slimy and when you slash it, it splashes everywhere. It's truly the worst!

column3: おう、へへっ、覚者か？
column4: Oh, heheh, you're an Arisen, huh?

column3:
白騎団をやってたんだが、退屈でこっちへ
ふらふら流れてきちまってな
俺ぁ本部じゃ行方不明のままかもしれねぇや
column4:
I used to be part of the White Knights, but it got boring, so I ended up wandering over here. 
I've been drifting aimlessly, and I might still be considered missing at headquarters.

column3: ゾマを守る騎士様ってのぁ俺のことよ！
column4: The knight who protects Zoma is me!

column3:
ハハッ、冗談冗談！
その役割はオリバーだな、間違いなく
column4:
Haha, joking joking!
That role is Oliver, no doubt about it.

column3:
酒を飲んで死なねぇ程度に遺跡荒らし
騎士より俺にゃそっちのが向いてるぜ
column4:
I'm an archaeologist who drinks enough alcohol to not die.
I'm more suited for that than being a knight.

column3: あぁ、なんだよなんだよ
column4: Ah, what is it, what is it

column3:
うぅ、いやだいやだ
古い遺物がざくざく手に入るって聞いたのに
とんでもないじゃないか！
column4:
Ugh, I don't want this, I don't want this at all.
I heard that I could easily obtain ancient artifacts, but this is absolutely ridiculous!

column3: 危なすぎるよここは！
column4: This place is too dangerous!

column3:
もう少し南で牧畜をやってたんだけど
良い儲け話があるなんてここへついてきたのが
間違いだったよ
column4: I was doing livestock farming a little further south, but coming here thinking there was a good money-making opportunity was a mistake.

column3: いいなぁ、あんた達は強そうで
column4: You guys seem really strong, don't you?

column3:
嫌な話ついでにだが、野盗の一派が
魔獣に何やら餌をやってるとこを見たんだよ
column4:
By the way, I have some unpleasant news. 
I saw a group of bandits feeding something to a magical beast.

column3:
黒くてけたたましい、羽根が生えたヤツだ

It's black and raucous and feathered.
I don't know what it's called or anything.

column3:
そいつらは《ザンドラ灯台》の方に戻ってったよ
もしやあの魔獣でここを襲うつもりじゃ
ないだろうなぁ
column4:
They returned towards Zandora Lighthouse.
Could it be that they intend to attack this place with that magical beast?
I hope not.

column3:
よぉ、いらっしゃい！
遺跡でなんか手に入れたら引き取るぜ！
column4: Hey there, welcome! If you find something in the ruins, I'll take care of it for you!

column3:
ザンドラは面白いモノが多いだろー？
特に、俺は錬金術関係の
ヘンテコな遺物が気に入っててさ
column4:
Zandora has many interesting things, right?
Especially, I really like the quirky alchemy-related relics.

column3:
金になるのはモチロンだけど
なんかちょっとホラ、芸術？
って感じしないか
column4: It's a money-maker, of course, but something a little hokey, art? It's a bit like art, isn't it?

column3:
俺は行商をやっててさ、リンウッドやローテス
ほかにもいくつかの村に行ったけど
ここが一番だね！
column4:
I'm working as a wandering merchant, you know. 
I've been to several villages like Lynwood and Rotes, but this one is the best!

column3:
なんか良くわからない活気があって
居心地いいんだよな
column4:
There's a vibrancy to it that I don't really understand.
It's very cozy.

column3:
やっぱ遺跡はロマンだよな！
ドリード城や禊の神殿もいいけどさ
より未知であるほど燃えるよな！
column4:
Indeed, ruins are full of romance, aren't they? 
Dreed Castle and the Temple of Purification are great, but the more unknown they are, the more thrilling they become!

column3:
《東ザンドラ廃墟群》は知ってるかい？
昔の住居が遺跡んなって残ってるんだ
ちょうど、ゾマから坂を上っていったとこだよ
column4:
Do you know about the East Zandora Ruins? 
It's where the old residences have become ancient relics. 
It's right up the hill from Zoma.

column3:
そこの遺跡は今でも結構、旧時代の遺物やら
何やらが見つかるらしいんだよね
まだまだスゴイのが眠ってんじゃないかなぁ
column4:
I hear you can still find relics and things from the old days at the ruins there.
I wonder if there are still some amazing things lying around.

column3: うむ、何か言ったか？
column4: Mm, what did you say?

column3:
うむ――どうすればオリバー殿は
私の弟子入りを認めて下さるのか
column4: Hmm... How can I make Lord Oliver accept me as his disciple?

column3:
例えばそうだな、恐ろしい噂のある
《呪詛の庭》に現れるという闇の使いを
倒すことができれば――あるいは――
column4: For example, if you manage to defeat the darkness envoy that appears in the "Garden of Curses," a place with terrifying rumors, then - perhaps - you will be able to...

column3:
いやしかし、それだけの腕がすでにあるなら
そもそも弟子入りの必要はないような――
うむ――悩ましいな
column4:
However, if you already have such skills, there might be no need to become a disciple---
Hmm, it's quite a dilemma.

column3:
ふぅ
どうも私はここの雰囲気が苦手だ
column4: Phew. I really don't like the atmosphere here.

ひっきりなしに声を掛けられて
落ち着いて食事もできない
column4: Being constantly approached and unable to have a peaceful meal.

column3:
私はこれでも一介の剣士
墓荒らしではない
剣の技を求めてここへ来た
column4:
I am just a swordsman, not a grave robber.
I came here in search of swordsmanship.

column3: オリバー殿の太刀筋を見るためにな
column4: To witness the swordsmanship of Lord Oliver.

column3: オリバー殿は類稀なる剛剣の使い手
column4: Lord Oliver is a skillful wielder of a rare fortified sword.

column3:
私はあの方に認められるまで
ここに滞在し己の技を磨こうと思う
column4: I'm going to stay here and hone my craft until he approves.

column3:
――ほう、ほうほう！
良いッ！　良いぞおぬしッ！！
column4: Oh, I see, I see! Well done! Excellent, my good sir!

column3:
あの偏屈ながら確かな目を持つ
ナディアが認めたということは
この東ザンドラで相当の死合いを
くぐり抜けてきたと見える！
column4: The fact that even Nadia, with her eccentric yet keen eyes, has acknowledged it means they must have endured some serious battles here in East Zandora!

column4: Are ye aspiring to be a Warrior?

column3:
両手に握りしめたエモノに

恍惚の時ッ！！
column4:
With a firm grasp on it in both hands, I gather all my strength, concentrate and swing down!!
It is a moment of ecstasy so intense that I feel the world revolves around my arms.

column3:
――おおおおッ！
今、鼻の穴が開いたな！？

column4:
――Ohhh! My nostrils are flaring!

It has to be like this!

column3:
遠慮することはない！
我が課題に挑戦するが良い！
column4:

You should challenge yourself to tackle my task!

column3:
さすればこのオリバー

column4: Then this Oliver will take you as a "Warrior" and propel you to even greater heights of strength!

フハハハハッ！！
どうした、声が小さいぞ！！
column4:
Hahahahaha!
What's the matter, your voice is so quiet!

column3:
より強く、より熱く、そしてより激しくッ！！
剣を振れば振るうほど、その頂きが
いかに遠いか思い知る日々よッ！
column4:
Stronger, hotter, and fiercer!
The more I swing my sword, the more I realize how far away the top is!

column3: そうは思わないか！？　ん？
column4: Don't you think so?! Hm?

column3:
うむ！　おぬしはなかなかの猛者と見たッ！！
どうだこのゾマは！！
column4:
Indeed! I see you are quite the formidable warrior!! 
How about this Zoma!!

column3: 腕を磨くには持って来いだろう！？
column4: It would be perfect to enhance your skills, wouldn't it!?

column3:
むううううんッ！！
コロッサスもキメラももはや物足りん！！
column4:
Muuuuunnnn!
Colossus and Chimera are no longer enough!

我が死合いの相手が務まるは

column4:
Is there anyone capable of facing me in battle?
Someone as skilled as an ancient clockwork doll!

column3:
おぬし、受けた傷の痛みは忘れんと
いう気概はあるか！？
column4: Do you have the determination not to forget the pain of the wounds you've received!?

column3:
《ウォリアー》たるもの、わが身に受けし

column3:
フハハハハハッ！！
うむ、おぬしの覚悟、しかと認めたりッ！
column4: Hahaha! Arisen, I have duly recognized your resolve!

column3:
《ウォリアー》として剛の剣を振るうに

《ウォリアー》なれば、最強の強者を

column4:
To become a Warrior and strive for battle
Is my true wish and duty
To become the strongest of the strong

ファイターとは根本的に違う生き物だという

ファイターとは異なる剛の剣、それが

A sword of Strength, distinct from a Fighter;
that is the Warrior!!

盾など不要！　敵にぶつかり叩き潰すッ！

The fighting spirit that fills your whole body, such extraordinary determination! 
You're quite something!

――良い、良いぞォッ！！

伝授してくれよう
column4:

Hah, I shall teach you the secret technique of my formidable sword!

Now, learn it!

Cleave, defeat, and crush all enemies in your path!!

さすればこのオリバー
おぬしを《ウォリアー》として、さらなる
強者の高みに推し上げてくれるッ！！！
column4: Then this Oliver will take you as a "Warrior" and propel you to even greater heights of strength!

column3:
さぁッ、遠慮することはない！
共に試練を越え歩もうではないか！
強者の頂きへッ！！
column4:
Now, there's no need to hold back!
Let's overcome trials together and move forward!
To the peak of the mighty!!

column3:
おお、あの偏屈ながら確かな目を持つ
ナディアに認められし戦士というのは
おぬしか！
column4: Oh, that eccentric yet perceptive warrior recognized by Nadia, could it be you?!

column3:
ほうほう、ふむふむ！
なかなかどうして気張っているようだな！
column4:
Hmmm... hmmm... hmmm... hmmm... hmmm... hmmm!
You seem to be quite determined!

column3:
――が、まだまだだ！
おぬしが《ウォリアー》として真の強者を
目指すなら、まずは自力で
ジョブレベル１８に至るのだッ！！
column4:
- However, you still have a long way to go!!
If you aspire to be a true strong warrior, first of all, strive to reach Level 18 in your job by your own effort!!

column3:
しかる後、おぬしの戦いぶりを見てきた
訓練官から新たな修練への太鼓判を
もらうがいい！
column4: Afterwards, you should receive the trainer's endorsement for further training, having witnessed your fighting style!

column3:
おぬしが我が前に現れるのを
楽しみに待っているぞッ！
column4: I eagerly await your appearance before me!

column3:
ほほう！　その力コブに強き眼光――
すでに基本の心得は掴んだと見た
レベルとしては十分よッ！
column4:
Oh ho! That strong gaze of yours, focused on your goal.
I can see that you have already grasped the basics.
As far as levels go, you are more than sufficient!

column3:
《ウォリアー》としての道を究めんとするならば
おぬしの戦いぶりを見てきた
訓練官から新たな修練への太鼓判を
もらうがいい！
column4: If you seek to master the path of the 'Warrior,' then you should receive the trainer's endorsement for further training, having witnessed your fighting style!

column3:
しかる後、我が前に戻れ！
その時こそ真のウォリアーとしての
一歩が始まるのだッ！！
column4:
Afterwards, return before me!
That is when the true Warrior's first step begins!!

column3: ウフ！　お飲み物はいかが？
column4: Ah! Would you like something to drink?

column3:
美味しい食事にお飲み物！
今日は休んで騒いで
また明日、冒険を頑張ってねぇ！
column4:
A delicious meal with a beverage! 
Take a break today and have some fun. And tomorrow, have an adventure and give it your best!

column3:
リキュールのブレンド、絶賛研究中よ！
意外な物がお酒の隠し味になるんだから
column4:
I'm currently conducting research on blending liqueurs!
Unexpected ingredients can become a hidden flavor in alcohol, you know.

column3:
あらステキ！　逞しい身体ね
惚れ惚れしちゃうなぁ～
column4:
Wonderful! 
You have a strong body. 
It's mesmerizing.

column3:
あら――
死と名誉、欲とロマンのザンドラ東部へようこそ
神殿付の真面目さん
column4:
Oh, the serious person from the temple-
Welcome to Eastern Zandora, a place of death and honor, desire and romance.

column3:
私はナディア
このゾマ周辺のエリアマスターをしているの
column4:
My name is Nadia.
I am the Area Master of this area of Zoma.

column3:
見てのとおり、ここは危険に満ちた土地
だからこそ強い人を惹きつけ
そして相応しい者をより輝かせる――
column4: As you can see, this is a land filled with danger. And thus, it attracts strong individuals and makes those who are worthy shine even brighter-

column3: もしくは、朽ちて彷徨う死者の１人にする――
column4: Or make them one of the wandering dead -

column3:
貴方はどうかしらね？
さぁ、精一杯駆けまわって見せて
column4:
How about you?
Come on, let's see you run around as much as you can.

column3: 諸々のご協力感謝するわ
column4: I appreciate all of your assistance.

column3:
貴方は面白い人だから
次からの支援品に色をつけてあげるわね
だから、もっといろいろして見せて頂戴――
column4:
You are an interesting person, so I will add some color to the next support goods for you.
Therefore, please show me more of your various talents.

column3:
ねぇ。ザンドラ禁域へ続く《奇岩谷》の
ガレキが除去されて、通行可能になったわよ
それは良かったんだけど、道中に
気味の悪い魔物がはびこっているの
column4:
Hey. 
The debris in the "Odd Rock Valley" that leads to the forbidden zone of Zandora has been removed, making it passable. 
That's good news, but there are creepy enemies lurking along the way.

column3:
どうしてかしら
あの辺りは、そういった魔物が湧きやすい
らしくてね
column4: I wonder why that area is said to be prone to the emergence of such enemies.

column3:
不快だし、ロマンの地には似つかわしくない
魔物だし――
見かけたら掃除しておいてくれないかしら
column4:
It's unpleasant and not suitable for a romantic place.
Because it's an enemy —
Could you please clean it up if you see it?

column3: ザンドラでの冒険、慣れてきたようね
column4: Adventure in Zandora, you seem to be getting used to it, don't you?

column3:
貴方にもっと輝いてもらうために
紹介したい人がいるの
column4: To make you shine even more, There's someone I want to introduce to you.

column3:
《オズワルドの店》に滞在している大剣豪
《ウォリアー》のジョブマスター、オリバーよ
column4: To the esteemed Job Master of the Warrior, Oliver, staying at Oswald's Shop.

column3:
あらゆるものを薙ぎ払い
打ち砕く剛き一撃――
column4: Striking down and crushing everything with a mighty blow—

column3:
きっと貴方なら、その戦い方も
使いこなせると思うわ
column4: I'm sure you'll be able to use that fighting style too!

column3:
――ふふ、弟子入りの順番待ちをしてる
ソーニャには悪いけどね
column4: Hehe, I feel sorry for Sonia, who's waiting her turn to become an apprentice.

column3:
《ウォリアー》として
さらなる輝きを得たければ、会ってみて
column4: If you want to achieve even more brilliance as a Warrior, meet me and see for yourself.

column3:
そうだわ
セラー湖の岸辺にある《禊の神殿　離殿》は
通ったことがあるかしら？
column4:
I see. 
Have you ever been to the Temple of Purification: South Chamber on the shores of Lake Cera?

column3:
あの建物には地下があってね――
《湖底連絡路》という、セラー湖の底を
巡るように繋がれた水路よ
column4: In that building, there is an underground passage, called the "Lakebottom Connecting Passage," which connects the bottom of Lake Cera like a canal.

column3:
あまりに広く、探索にいって迷う人が
多いから封鎖していたのだけれど
もしかしたら変わった魔物や財宝が
眠ってる――かもしれないわね
column4:
Because so many people get lost when they go exploring, we've had it blocked off.
But there might be unique enemies and treasures that are sleeping there— maybe.

column3:
入り口、入れるようにしておくわ
興味があったらご自由にどうぞ――ふふ
column4:
I will make sure to leave the entrance open for you.
Feel free to come in if you're interested―― hehe

column3:
すごい活躍ね
酒場でも貴方の噂をよく耳にするわ
column4:
You're doing great!
I often hear rumors about you at the Tavern.

column3:
ここが活気づいてきたのも
貴方のお陰かしら
column4: Is it thanks to you that this place has become lively?

column3:
支援品に色をつけてあげるわ
これからも頼むわね
column4:
I'll add some color to your support items.
Keep up the good work.

column3:
そうだわ、ちょっと気になることがあってね
貴方の力をあてにさせてもらいたいの
column4: Yes, I'm a little concerned about something and I'd like to count on your help.

column3:
《東ザンドラ廃墟群》――
丘を少し登った遺跡街に
炎を纏ったゴーレムが現れたの
column4: "East Zandora Ruins" - As I approached the ancient city on top of the hill, a Golem clad in flames appeared.

column3:
突然どうして現れたのかしら
誰かが遺跡にあった起動装置を
動かしでもしたのかしら
column4:
I wonder why it suddenly appeared. 
Did someone activate the power device that was in the ruins, perhaps?

column3:
で、そのゴーレムがどうもゾマの方へ
向かうそぶりを見せているらしいのよ
怖いわね――ふふ
column4:
And so, it seems that the Golem is showing signs of heading towards Zoma. 
How scary... hehe

column3:
というわけで、何とかしてくれないかしら
正式なお願いよ
column4:
So please do something about it.
It's a formal request.

column3:
ねぇ、そういえば
この地の北にある《ザンドラ灯台》のことは
知ってる？
column4: Hey, speaking of which, do you know about the Zandora Lighthouse located to the north of this area?

column3:
灯台で、バルバロイの一派が魔獣を
飼いはじめたようなの
column4: It seems like the faction of Barbarians has started keeping magical beasts at the lighthouse.

column3:
噂によれば、トサカと大きな黒い翼を
持つ魔物らしいわ
column4: According to rumors, it seems to be an enemy with a crest and large black wings.

column3:
灯台や廃墟群にいる間はいいけれど
野蛮なバルバロイ達がゾマにきたら厄介だわ
column4: While I'm at the lighthouse or in the ruins, it's fine, but it would be troublesome if those barbarians come to Zoma.

column3:
誰か強い人が――
何とかしてくれないかしら
ねぇ――？
column4:
Is there anyone strong-
Who could do something, I wonder?
Hey-?

column3:
本当に大したものだわ
荒くれ者ばかりのゾマで
貴方ほど探索と戦いの両方に長けた人は
見たことがない
column4:
You're really something, aren't you?
In the rough Zoma where there are only thugs, I have never seen anyone as skilled as you in both exploration and battle.

column3:
貴方と知り合えて、嬉しく思うわ
報酬というのもおこがましいけれど
これからは他の人とは違う、特別な支援を
してあげる――
column4:
I am happy to have met you, although it feels presumptuous to talk about rewards.
From now on, I will provide you with special support that is different from anyone else's.

column3:
私自身も惹かれてしまいそうね
ふふ――
column4:
I myself am also drawn to it, it seems.
Hehe...

column3:
ねぇ――
死者の丘、ゾマの裏手に広がる
高台に《呪詛の庭》と呼ばれる場所があるの
column4:
Hey—
At the back of Zoma, on a hill called the Hill of the Dead, There is a place called the "Garden of Curses."

column3:
人の恨みと死者の魂を吸い
得体の知れぬ"実"をぶらさげた木々が
茂る、《虚ろの祠》に接した庭よ
column4:
In the garden that adjoins the "Shrine of Emptiness",
Trees hung with mysterious "seeds" that absorb the grudges of people and the souls of the deceased flourish.

column3:
そこでね、先日祠に盗掘にいった人達が
皆殺しにされたの
column4: So you know, the people who went to desecrate the shrine the other day were all killed.

column3:
何が彼らの命を奪ったのかしらね――
気になると思わない？
column4:
I wonder what took their lives--
Don't you think it's curious?

column3:
そろそろあなたに
きちんと依頼を出してみようかしら
column4: Perhaps it's about time I properly request something from you.

column3:
私が頼みたいのは
死者の丘、最大の謎――
"亡霊騎士と呪いの秘宝"の解明なの
column4:
I'm asking you to help me solve the greatest mystery of the Hill of the Dead--
"The Ghost Knight and the Cursed Treasure".

column3:
その秘宝があると言われているのは
ザンドラ礼拝堂の地下に広がる
《死王の迷宮》よ
column4: It is said that the secret treasure is located in the underground of Zandora Chapel, spread out in the Dead Lord's Labyrinth.

column3:
――私はその奥に何があるのか
知りたいの
column4: --I want to know what's behind it

column3:
そのためだけに
ここで貴方のような人を待ちながら
エリアマスターをしてきたのかも――
column4: Perhaps, it was for the sake of waiting for someone like you here that I became an Area Master.

column3:
でも、あそこは冗談抜きで危険な場所
挑むかどうかは貴方に委ねるわ
column4:
But that's a dangerous place, no joke.
I'll leave it up to you to decide if you want to take on the challenge.

column3:
本当に大したものだわ
荒くれ者ばかりのゾマで、貴方ほど
探索と戦いの両方に長けた人は見たことがない
column4:
You're really something, aren't you?
In the rough Zoma where there are only thugs, I have never seen anyone as skilled as you in both exploration and battle.

column3:
貴方と知り合えて、嬉しく思うわ
報酬というのもおこがましいけれど
これを持って行って
column4:
I am happy to have met you, although it feels presumptuous to talk about rewards. 
From now on, I will provide you with special support that is different from anyone else's.

column3:
――ん、私自身も惹かれてしまいそう
ふふ――
column4:
I myself am also drawn to it, it seems.
Hehe...

column3:
すごい活躍だそうね
酒場でも貴方の噂をよく耳にするわ
column4: I often hear rumors about your great achievements. Your fame reaches even the Tavern.

column3:
ここが活気づいてきたのも貴方のお陰かしら
はい、このところの働きへの贈り物よ
また頼むわね
column4:
Is it thanks to you that this place has become lively, I wonder? 
Yes, this is a gift for your recent work. 
I will rely on you again.

column3:
諸々のご協力感謝するわ
はい、これを受け取って
ゾマを代表して私から、あなたへの贈り物よ
column4:
Thanks for all your help.
Yes, take this.
My gift to you on behalf of Zoma.

column3:
――逞しい人って、素敵
いつも良くしてくれるあなたには
これを進呈するわ
column4:
A reliable person is wonderful, isn't it? 
For always treating me well, I offer this to you.

column3:
あなたにだけ特別よ――
他の連中には内緒ね
column4: This is just for you— It's a secret from the others.

column3: いつでも待っているわ、ふふ――
column4: Any time, I'll be waiting, hehe...

column3:
はい、今回の支援品よ
貴方には粗品じゃ物足りないだろうと思って
少しグレードを上げてみたわ
column4:
Yes, this time's support goods.
I thought regular goods wouldn't be enough for you, so I upgraded them a bit.

column3: 役に立てて頂戴
column4: Please make use of it.

column3:
ちょうど今日は、探索者の支援日なの
これ、差し入れよ、使ってちょうだい
column4: Today is the day of support for adventurers. Here, please take this as a treat and use it.

column3:
ゾマにようこそ
何か相談事かしら
column4:
Welcome to Zoma.
Is there something you wish to discuss?

column3:
ふふ――
私はここに集う人達を見るのが好き
column4:
Hehe...
I like seeing the people gathered here.

column3:
野望とか夢とか、ロマンとか力試しとか
そんな漠然としたモノに酔ってる人達って
可愛いと思わない？
column4: Don't you think people who are intoxicated by such vague things like ambition, dreams, romance, and tests of strength are adorable?

column3:
チャンスの一欠片を、少しでも多くの人に
伝えてあげたいの
ここには、そういう話が集まるから
column4:
I want to convey a fragment of a chance to as many people as possible.
Because stories like that gather here.

column3:
ゾマにはもっと華やかに、より危険に
なってもらいたいわ
そして、ぎらぎらした人を呼び込むの
column4:
I want Zoma to become more glamorous and dangerous.
And thus, attract dazzling people.

column3:
そういう人の中から、失われた黄金郷へ
真に辿りつける人が出るかもしれないから
column4: Because among such people, there might be someone who can truly reach the lost golden paradise.

column3: そして、深い迷宮の奥にもね――
column4: And thus, even in the depths of a profound labyrinth...

column3:
《辺境の礎》ってあるわよね
この辺りにあるソレが全て使えるようになったそうよ
ついさっき、神殿からの使いがそう言っていたわ
column4:
There's a "Sub Portcrystal".
 It seems like everything around here can be used now. 
Just a moment ago, a messenger from the temple said so.

column3:
不便だったところへも一瞬で移動できる
優れものだと聞いたけど――
何だか無粋だわ
column4:
I've heard it's great to get to places that were inconvenient in an instant, but--
it's kind of tacky.

column3:
私はね、ザンドラ東部に来たのなら自分の足で
移動してほしいと思ってるのよ
この荒れ地に転がる数々のロマンの欠片を
見落としてほしくないもの――
column4:
You know, if you've come to Eastern Zandora, I'd like you to move on your own. 
I don't want you to miss the scattered fragments of romance that lie in this wild land—

column3:
ねぇ――最近、ここから東の方で
大きな鎧が暴れているらしいのよ――
column4: Hey... Lately, it seems like there's a big armor causing trouble somewhere east from here...

column3:
きっと何らかの魔力で操られた鎧が
あの場所に染みついた死臭に導かれて
やって来たのね
column4: The armor, likely manipulated by some kind of magic, has come to that place guided by the stench of death that permeates it.

column3:
ふふ、この辺りでは珍しいことじゃないわ――
特にあそこは人獣問わず死体が多くて
《屍のすすり泣く地》なんて呼ばれているんですもの
column4:
Hehe, it's not unusual around here, you know-- especially that place, where there are many corpses, regardless of whether they are human or animals. 
It's called the "Weeping Corpse Ground," after all.

column3:
だけど、鎧のうろつく範囲が
段々拡がってきているらしいのが気がかりなの
このゾマにまでやってきたら――
column4:
But I'm concerned that the range of armor wandering around seems to be getting wider and wider.
If it gets to this Zoma...

column3:
探求者たちを支える町が潰えては、大変
頼もしい誰かが討伐に行ってくれないかしら――
ねぇ？
column4:
If the town that supports the adventurers collapses, it will be a disaster.
I wonder if someone reliable could go and subdue it, I wonder...
Hey?

column3:
そうね、《幽玄の霊堂》のことはもう知っていて？
どんな場所かって？
カタコンベ――そう、地下墓地よ
column4:
So then, do you already know about the Mysterious Mausoleum?
What kind of place is it?
Catacombs――yes, an underground graveyard.

column3:
元は歴史ある霊堂だったそうよ
けど、今は眠りにつくことができない死者たちが
彷徨い続けているんだとか――
column4:
Originally, it was a historic mausoleum, they say.
But now, it seems that the deceased who cannot find rest continue to wander.

column3:
死者たちは本当に眠りにつくことが
できなかったのかしら？
それとも故郷であるザンドラがこんなことになって
無念さのあまり眠りから覚めてしまったのかしら――
column4: I wonder if the deceased were truly unable to rest in peace, or if their homeland, Zandora, becoming like this caused them to awaken from their slumber out of overwhelming regret.

column3:
そういえば
あの人たちまだ帰ってこないのよね――
column4: Speaking of which, that guy hasn't come back yet--

column3:
ふふ、この前《幽玄の霊堂》に
意気揚々と盗掘に行った若者のことよ
column4: Hmmm, I'm talking about the young man who went to the other day to steal from the Mysterious Mausoleum.

column3:
まだ若い子たちだったんだけど
若さ故の無謀さで
死者の仲間入りをしちゃったのかしら
column4: They were still young, but in their youthful recklessness, I wonder if they joined the dead.

column3:
あら、貴方――
気になるって顔してるわね
よっぽど人が良いのかしら？
column4:
Oh, you... 
You have such an interested look on your face. 
I wonder if you're a really kind person?

column3:
いいわ、もし様子を見に行きたいなら
私に相談して
column4: If you wish to go and see for yourself, please consult with me.

column3:
今や貴方はこのゾマで
一番の探索者、そして戦士よ
貴方のような存在そのものがロマンと言っても
いいんじゃないかしら
column4:
Now, you are the greatest explorer and warrior in this Zoma. 
It might even be right to call an existence like you 'romance'.

column3:
貴方と知り合えて、嬉しく思うわ
支援品をうんと格上のものにするから
また話を聞かせてちょうだい
column4:
I am glad to have met you.
I will upgrade the support goods even more, So please let me hear your story again.

column3:
――ん、私ったら貴方に惹かれてるのかしら
ふふ――
column4: Hmm, I wonder if I'm attracted to you. Hehe...

column3: 何だァ？　用があるならさっさと言いな
column4: What is it?　If you have something to say, just say it.

column3:
俺はな、ダイアンの野郎とは違うんだよ！
レッキとした正規の騎士様なんだぞ、おう！
column4: I'm different from that guy Dion, you know! I'm a proper knight, yeah!

column3:
まーったく、こんな辺境に派遣されるとは
ついてねェぜ
column4: I can't believe I was dispatched to such a remote place. This is just my luck.

column3:
どんなとこでも行ってやらァ、任せとけ
とは言ったがよ
酒の席のセリフを真に受けるかよフツウ！
あァッ！？
column4:
I'll go anywhere and do it, leave it to me! 
That's what I said, but seriously, who takes lines from a drinking party seriously? Seriously!?

column3:
別に騎士団が守んなくてもよォ
ここの連中はそれなりにどいつも

《バートランド平原》側への

Good luck with your mission!

Permission from your superiors is required to pass through this main gate. 
Beyond the fortress lies the Betland Plains, a highly dangerous area.

よほどの任務か理由でもなければ
おいそれとは通れないさ

Unless it's a significant mission or reason,
You can't just pass through casually.

column4:
The Betland Plains in the north is close to the stronghold of the orcs.
Fort Gritten is vital in fending off their invasion.

ハイデルに奴らを通すわけにはいかないのだ
column4:
The northern enemies are not only formidable, but their numbers are also high.
We cannot let them through to Heidell.

column4: Hey, you must be tired.

First, the "Lakeside Ruins" near Lake Cera.
Large enemies tend to appear for some reason.

こっちはよほどの偵察でもなけりゃ

オークの部隊が巡回していることがあるんだ

Unless you're on a serious reconnaissance mission, you probably won't go there, but there are times when Orc units patrol the area.

column3:

Well, in the end, everywhere is relatively dangerous.

column3:

That's not a good omen, is it?

column3:

生きてるからだよなぁ
column4: Well, but I'm only able to complain about that because I'm alive.

I guess even the vice-captain's over-the-top praise is understandable.

Both me and the others know that.

You should be proud, yeah.

Take a look inside and if there are demons, then defeat them!
--Yeah well, that's it, simple, right?

column4: When you're ready to take on the assignment, give me a call again.

column4:

In the northern part of the plain, near the Orc stronghold, underneath Betland Bridge, a group of elite Orcs has been sighted.

column4: I have already reported it to Vice Captain Vanessa, but if you think you can address it, I also ask for your assistance.

column4: Very recently, that blockade was found to have been broken.
